content: The Rise of Worse is Better, by Adrian Colyer: https://blog.acolyer.org/2016/09/15/the-rise-of-worse-is-better/ he make some comments about the famous Worse is Better paper, that talks about the difference of cultures between the Lisp community and the c&UNIX community... It's an interesting paper, and an interesting post. This post is part of the The morning paper blog, where Adrian posts about some CS papers and what he thinks about them. You should subscribe to the mailing list (or add it to your RSS feed, if you still use it) The Rise of Worse is Better blog.acolyer.org

content: Worse is better, Richard P. Gabriel http://dreamsongs.com/WorseIsBetter.html Worse Is Better Worse Is Better. Richard P. Gabriel. The concept known as "worse is better" holds that in software making (and perhaps in other arenas as well) it is better to start with a minimal creation and grow it as needed. Christopher Alexander might call this "piecemeal growth. dreamsongs.com
